title: Angelic being
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Angelic_being/ko "Angelic being/ko")

The **angelic being** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the uppercase [A](/wiki/A "A") glyph (A). Angelic beings are designated internally by the macro **S\_ANGEL**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains the following [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster"):[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- A [couatl](/wiki/Couatl "Couatl")
- A [Aleax](/wiki/Aleax "Aleax")
- A [Angel](/wiki/Angel "Angel")
- A [ki-rin](/wiki/Ki-rin "Ki-rin")
- A [Archon](/wiki/Archon "Archon")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [3.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.4 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [3.7 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [5 References](#References)

## Common traits

All angelic beings are lawful with the exception of Angels: though an Angel's default alignment is lawful, Angels that serve as the [minion](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of a [god](/wiki/God "God") will have the same alignment as that god.

Angelic beings are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and [inediate](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate") monsters that are considered [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY"), have [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), can be seen with infravision, and can [follow](/wiki/Follow "Follow") the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") to other levels if they are adjacent. Angelic beings can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly") with the exception of the Aleax, and can all [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible") except for the couatl. Angelic beings ignore the effects of [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") as well as occupied [sanctuary](/wiki/Sanctuary "Sanctuary").

Except for the ki-rin, angelic beings possess [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Ki-rin also possess poison resistance.

### Generation

Randomly-generated angelic beings are likely to be created peaceful towards [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") characters that have good [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"), with the exception of Angels: Angels that serve the same god as the hero, or else are "renegade" servants of other gods are likely to be peaceful if the hero has good alignment record; Angels that serve different gods from the hero or are "renegade" servants of the hero's god will always be hostile. Angelic beings will never be generated randomly in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

[Humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") angelic beings are [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an uncursed [erodeproof](/wiki/Erodeproof "Erodeproof") +0 [large shield](/wiki/Large_shield "Large shield") 3⁄4 of the time, and an uncursed +0 [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") otherwise, and their weapon will be a blessed erodeproof [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") of an enchantment from +0 to +3, with a 1⁄5 chance of the sword being made into either [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane") or [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword") if neither artifact has been generated.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) A humanoid angelic being that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") to their kind, i.e. an Archon, will always generate with a shield of reflection, and their long sword will always be made into an artifact if possible.

Angelic beings [do not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Demonbane's base item is changed to a [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), so no angelic being can generate with it.

## History

Angelic beings are all introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

- A [movanic deva](/wiki/Movanic_deva "Movanic deva")
- A [monadic deva](/wiki/Monadic_deva "Monadic deva")
- A [astral deva](/wiki/Astral_deva "Astral deva")
- A [Planetar](/wiki/Planetar "Planetar")
- A [Solar](/wiki/Solar "Solar")

Angelic beings other than the couatl and Aleax possess [death resistance](/wiki/Death_resistance "Death resistance"), and all angelic beings [need a weapon of a certain enchantment to be hit](/wiki/Need_%2Bx_weapon_to_hit "Need +x weapon to hit"), while [hitting as weapons of that same enchantment](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon"). Planetars and Solars are considered lords to their kind.

Tame angelic beings can be gifted as minions to lawful characters via [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") or [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer"), except for Angels and Aleaxes.

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

- A [Dark Angel](/wiki/Dark_Angel "Dark Angel")
- A [weeping angel](/index.php?title=Weeping_angel_\(UnNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Weeping angel (UnNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- A [weeping archangel](/index.php?title=Weeping_archangel_\(UnNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Weeping archangel (UnNetHack) (page does not exist)")

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), there are three separate monster classes for angels and minions of each alignment. Lawful angels and minions consist of the angelic beings from *NetHack* alongside several other monsters, and both lawful and neutral angels and minions use different glyphs - chaotic angels and minions retain the A glyph.

The three alignments of angelic being or minion are listed below:

- [Lawful angels and minions](/wiki/Lawful_angels_and_minions "Lawful angels and minions")
- [Neutral angels and minions](/wiki/Neutral_angels_and_minions "Neutral angels and minions")
- [Chaotic angels and minions](/wiki/Chaotic_angels_and_minions "Chaotic angels and minions")

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") includes the angelic beings from SLASH'EM and adds several more to the monster class:

- A [lamassu](/wiki/Lamassu "Lamassu")
- A [movanic deva](/wiki/Movanic_deva "Movanic deva")
- A [monadic deva](/wiki/Monadic_deva "Monadic deva")
- A [astral deva](/wiki/Astral_deva "Astral deva")
- A [Hound Archon](/index.php?title=Hound_Archon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hound Archon (page does not exist)")
- A [Herald Archon](/index.php?title=Herald_Archon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Herald Archon (page does not exist)")
- A [Hearth Archon](/index.php?title=Hearth_Archon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hearth Archon (page does not exist)")
- A [Throne Archon](/index.php?title=Throne_Archon_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Throne Archon (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")
- A [Planetar](/wiki/Planetar "Planetar")
- A [Solar](/wiki/Solar "Solar")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

- A [eldritch ki-rin](/wiki/Eldritch_ki-rin "Eldritch ki-rin")
- A [Archangel](/wiki/Archangel "Archangel")
- A [Saint Michael](/index.php?title=Saint_Michael\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Saint Michael (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

In addition to the monsters from SLASH'EM, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

- A [Douglas Adams](/wiki/Douglas_Adams_\(monster\) "Douglas Adams (monster)")
- A [weeping angel](/index.php?title=Weeping_angel_\(SlashTHEM\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Weeping angel (SlashTHEM) (page does not exist)")
- A [weeping archangel](/index.php?title=Weeping_archangel_\(SlashTHEM\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Weeping archangel (SlashTHEM) (page does not exist)")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds several angelic bring to the monster class, including many from SLASH'EM, SpliceHack and EvilHack:

- A [lamassu](/wiki/Lamassu "Lamassu")
- A [movanic deva](/wiki/Movanic_deva "Movanic deva")
- A [eldritch ki-rin](/wiki/Eldritch_ki-rin "Eldritch ki-rin")
- A [monadic deva](/wiki/Monadic_deva "Monadic deva")
- A [astral deva](/wiki/Astral_deva "Astral deva")
- A [Archangel](/wiki/Archangel "Archangel")
- A [Planetar](/wiki/Planetar "Planetar")
- A [Solar](/wiki/Solar "Solar")

## Encyclopedia entry

He answered and said unto them, he that soweth the good seed is the Son of man; the field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the weeds are the children of the wicked one; the enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels. As therefore the weeds are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world. \[...] So shall it be at the end of the world; the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just, and shall cast them into the furnace of fire; there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

\[ The Gospel According to Matthew, 13:37-42, 49-50 ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 41](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L41)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 985](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L985)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 326](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L326)

html:
Angelic being

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

The angelic being is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the uppercase A glyph (A). Angelic beings are designated internally by the macro S_ANGEL.[1]

The monster class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • A couatl
  • A Aleax
  • A Angel
  • A ki-rin
  • A Archon

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 UnNetHack
    • 3.3 dNetHack
    • 3.4 SpliceHack
    • 3.5 EvilHack
    • 3.6 SlashTHEM
    • 3.7 Hack'EM
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Common traits

All angelic beings are lawful with the exception of Angels: though an Angel's default alignment is lawful, Angels that serve as the minion of a god will have the same alignment as that god.

Angelic beings are strong and inediate monsters that are considered nasty, have infravision, can be seen with infravision, and can follow the hero to other levels if they are adjacent. Angelic beings can fly with the exception of the Aleax, and can all see invisible except for the couatl. Angelic beings ignore the effects of Elbereth as well as occupied sanctuary.

Except for the ki-rin, angelic beings possess poison resistance.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Ki-rin also possess poison resistance.

Generation

Randomly-generated angelic beings are likely to be created peaceful towards lawful characters that have good alignment record, with the exception of Angels: Angels that serve the same god as the hero, or else are "renegade" servants of other gods are likely to be peaceful if the hero has good alignment record; Angels that serve different gods from the hero or are "renegade" servants of the hero's god will always be hostile. Angelic beings will never be generated randomly in Gehennom.

Humanoid angelic beings are generated with an uncursed erodeproof +0 large shield 3⁄4 of the time, and an uncursed +0 shield of reflection otherwise, and their weapon will be a blessed erodeproof long sword of an enchantment from +0 to +3, with a 1⁄5 chance of the sword being made into either Demonbane or Sunsword if neither artifact has been generated.[3] A humanoid angelic being that is a lord to their kind, i.e. an Archon, will always generate with a shield of reflection, and their long sword will always be made into an artifact if possible.

Angelic beings do not leave a corpse upon death.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Demonbane's base item is changed to a mace, so no angelic being can generate with it.

History

Angelic beings are all introduced in NetHack 3.1.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

  • A movanic deva
  • A monadic deva
  • A astral deva
  • A Planetar
  • A Solar

Angelic beings other than the couatl and Aleax possess death resistance, and all angelic beings need a weapon of a certain enchantment to be hit, while hitting as weapons of that same enchantment. Planetars and Solars are considered lords to their kind.

Tame angelic beings can be gifted as minions to lawful characters via sacrifice or prayer, except for Angels and Aleaxes.

UnNetHack

UnNetHack adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

  • A Dark Angel
  • A weeping angel
  • A weeping archangel

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, there are three separate monster classes for angels and minions of each alignment. Lawful angels and minions consist of the angelic beings from NetHack alongside several other monsters, and both lawful and neutral angels and minions use different glyphs - chaotic angels and minions retain the A glyph.

The three alignments of angelic being or minion are listed below:

  • Lawful angels and minions
  • Neutral angels and minions
  • Chaotic angels and minions

SpliceHack

SpliceHack includes the angelic beings from SLASH'EM and adds several more to the monster class:

  • A lamassu
  • A movanic deva
  • A monadic deva
  • A astral deva
  • A Hound Archon
  • A Herald Archon
  • A Hearth Archon
  • A Throne Archon
  • A Planetar
  • A Solar

EvilHack

EvilHack adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

  • A eldritch ki-rin
  • A Archangel
  • A Saint Michael

SlashTHEM

In addition to the monsters from SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM adds some new angelic beings to the monster class:

  • A Douglas Adams
  • A weeping angel
  • A weeping archangel

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds several angelic bring to the monster class, including many from SLASH'EM, SpliceHack and EvilHack:

  • A lamassu
  • A movanic deva
  • A eldritch ki-rin
  • A monadic deva
  • A astral deva
  • A Archangel
  • A Planetar
  • A Solar

He answered and said unto them, he that soweth the good seed is the Son of man; the field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the weeds are the children of the wicked one; the enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels. As therefore the weeds are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world. [...] So shall it be at the end of the world; the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just, and shall cast them into the furnace of fire; there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

[ The Gospel According to Matthew, 13:37-42, 49-50 ]
